speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: SCENE III. A room in Cymbeline's palace.

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: Enter CYMBELINE, Lords, PISANIO, and Attendants

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Again; and bring me word how 'tis with her.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Exit an Attendant

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: A fever with the absence of her son,

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: A madness, of which her life's in danger. Heavens,

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: How deeply you at once do touch me! Imogen,

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: The great part of my comfort, gone; my queen

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Upon a desperate bed, and in a time

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: When fearful wars point at me; her son gone,

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: So needful for this present: it strikes me, past

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: The hope of comfort. But for thee, fellow,

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Who needs must know of her departure and

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Dost seem so ignorant, we'll enforce it from thee

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: By a sharp torture.

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: Sir, my life is yours;

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: I humbly set it at your will; but, for my mistress,

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: I nothing know where she remains, why gone,

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: Nor when she purposes return. Beseech your highness,

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: Hold me your loyal servant.

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: Good my liege,

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: The day that she was missing he was here:

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: I dare be bound he's true and shall perform

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: All parts of his subjection loyally. For Cloten,

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: There wants no diligence in seeking him,

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: And will, no doubt, be found.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: The time is troublesome.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: To PISANIO

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: We'll slip you for a season; but our jealousy

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Does yet depend.

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: So please your majesty,

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: The Roman legions, all from Gallia drawn,

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: Are landed on your coast, with a supply

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: Of Roman gentlemen, by the senate sent.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Now for the counsel of my son and queen!

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: I am amazed with matter.

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: Good my liege,

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: Your preparation can affront no less

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: Than what you hear of: come more, for more

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: you're ready:

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: The want is but to put those powers in motion

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: That long to move.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: I thank you. Let's withdraw;

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: And meet the time as it seeks us. We fear not

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: What can from Italy annoy us; but

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: We grieve at chances here. Away!

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Exeunt all but PISANIO

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: I heard no letter from my master since

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: I wrote him Imogen was slain: 'tis strange:

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: Nor hear I from my mistress who did promise

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: To yield me often tidings: neither know I

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: What is betid to Cloten; but remain

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: Perplex'd in all. The heavens still must work.

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: Wherein I am false I am honest; not true, to be true.

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: These present wars shall find I love my country,

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: Even to the note o' the king, or I'll fall in them.

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: All other doubts, by time let them be clear'd:

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: Fortune brings in some boats that are not steer'd.

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: Exit
